title: Exponential Distribution
contentHtml: The exponential distribution is a continuous probability distribution that models the time between independent and identically distributed events in a memoryless system.

workedExample.problemHtml: Suppose we have a memoryless system where the time between failures is exponentially distributed with rate parameter 位. What is the probability that the system fails within the next 5 units of time?

steps.explanation: We want to find the probability that the system fails within the next 5 units of time.
We evaluate the integral using the definition of the exponential distribution.

intuition: The exponential distribution is memoryless, meaning that the probability of an event occurring does not depend on any past events. This makes it a useful model for systems where failures are independent and identically distributed.

subject: probability
title: Exponential Distribution
contentHtml:
The exponential distribution is a fundamental continuous random variable in probability theory.

It's characterized by its memoryless property and strong connection to the Poisson distribution.

workedExample.problemHtml: Suppose we have a memoryless exponential distribution with rate parameter \lambda.

steps.description: Find the probability that the random variable exceeds some value t.
steps.explanation: This is because the distribution is memoryless, so the probability of exceeding t only depends on the time elapsed since the last event.

intuition: The exponential distribution is often used to model the time between events in a Poisson process. Its memoryless property makes it particularly useful for modeling systems where the probability of an event occurring doesn't depend on when the previous event occurred.

title: Exponential Distribution
contentHtml: The exponential distribution is a fundamental probability distribution that models memoryless phenomena.

workedExample.problemHtml: Suppose we have a memoryless process with rate parameter 位. Find the probability density function (PDF) of this process.

steps.description: Recall the definition of exponential distribution
steps.explanation: The memoryless property implies that the probability of an event occurring within a small time interval is proportional to the length of that interval.

workedExample.finalAnswer: The PDF is given by f(x) = 位e^(-位x)

intuition: The exponential distribution models phenomena where the probability of an event occurring does not depend on when it occurred, only how long ago it occurred.
realWorldApplications: In reliability engineering, the exponential distribution is used to model the time-to-failure of components in a system.
